## Datasets we use

In this course, we use the following datasets:

-   Random-Dataset-1
-   Random-Dataset-2
-   Random-Dataset-3

Here, we provide some meta-data about the datasets. Please take the time to carefully read this section before jumping in and wrangling data without knowing the design or variables collected.

::: callout-note
## Open source data: \~4 minutes

Data can be made publicly available. This is not a problem, despite GDPR regulatins. Datasets are often made available on websites such as [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/communities/eu/collections/subjects/mhealth?q=&f=resource_type%3Adataset&f=file_type%3Acsv&l=list&p=1&s=10&sort=newest).
:::

### :download: Accessing Random-Dataset-1

In order to access the dataset, we suggest using:

```{.r filename="my-report.qmd"}
post_meal_insulin <- readr::read_csv2("https://zenodo.org/records/4989220/files/Eliasson_data2.csv?download=1")
```
